metadata.title: CVE-2018-9240 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
ncmpc through 0.29 is prone to a NULL pointer dereference flaw. If a useruses the chat screen and another client sends a long chat message, a crashand denial of service could occur.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-9240` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ncmpc - 0.33-2
ncmpc-lyrics - 0.33-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ncmpc package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.33-2').
